reviewText: United States Champion MVP vs. Matt Hardy - The beginning of what has become the most entertaining fued currently on SmackDown!  Good opener here as they went to the top rope & stayed on the mat thoughout various times in the match.  These two meshed well together & it was given enough time (over 15 mins.) you would enjoy a rematch between the two.Crusierweight Open Match: Unlike other Crusierweight Opens, all the guys were in the ring at the same time & the first one to get the pin wins.  This was the best Crusierweight Match I've seen in WWE this year as it showcased what the division should be all about.  There was some high flyin'spots along with good fast paced in ring wrestling.  The ending with Hornswoggle was funny & it didn't take away from the match itself.  As a side note, listen for the line from JBL that said, "He's the shortest champion since Tazz" as that will come into play later on.Singapore On A Cane Match: I just didn't think this match was good at all.  They didn't mesh well & the cane didn't even come into play until the finish when Sandman finally got it but got that "backstabber" right afterwards before the cane was even used.Womens Champion Candice Michelle vs. Melina - I have to give credit to Candice Michelle as she's heavily improved in the ring as it showcased here.  Very good Women's match and another in a good series of womens matches been having after that WrestleMania disaster.  Check out what Candice did backstage after the match in a moment worthy of Ron Simmons' "DAMN!"Intercontinental Champion Umaga vs. Jeff Hardy - This match was good & watchable as they followed the basic formula of the Umaga beating down Hardy only for him to get his comeback and go back & forth with Umaga until Umaga overcame & got the victory.  This was one of the rare matches that the crowd got into thoughout the night which made it seem better but besides that, another good match.ECW Champion John Morrison vs. CM Punk - Before I get started, listen for Tazz's comeback to the J.B.L. line earlier in the show where he said something to the degree of "I'm not the type of color man to put myself over.  Nobody wants to hear that."  The match was better than their Vengeance encounter & comes in right behind their ECW on Sci-Fi match (where Punk won the title) as their best encounter.Bullrope Match: Dusty Rhodes vs. Randy Orton - This was a very short match that served it's purpose in that Randy Orton beat another legend...in this case, the legend who created the event itself.  Besides that & Cody Rhodes appearence after the match, nothing noteworthy here.World Champion Great Khali vs. Batista vs. Kane - Another injury & another champion in Khali here.  All I can really say about this match is that this match was alright whenever Khali wasn't in it as the only good spot he did was going through the ECW announce table (I guess the spanish guys got replaced?).  Batista & Kane tried but you can't pull a good performance out of a guy who doesn't have it in him.Right around here, there was a segment between Jerry Lawler & King Booker that would set up their fued on RAW for the coming weeks but nothing happened here & came off as a boring filler.WWE Champion John Cena vs. Bobby Lashley - While this match didn't have the buildup like WrestleMania, WWE sure did hype this match up like they would do a WM main event with video packages of each man's career throughout the night.  The match stated out slow but worked it's way up thoughout the match.  They exchanged some power moves with Lashley working on Cena's ribs throughout the match.  The ending had Cena dropping an FU from the top rope.  I thought this was Lashley's best PPV performance since before his ECW run while this was one of Cena's best "non-gimmick" matches during his WWE Championship run.Overall, this PPV WASN'T worth the $40 WWE charged you to see live on PPV but it's worth the money for a rental as the matches were good & watchable with few moments that you would use the "skip" button for.  I recommend for a rental or a purchase for a low price.
summary: Not Worth The Live PPV Price But Worth A Rental

reviewText: Let's be honest, WWE's last three attempts at THE GREAT AMERICAN BASH have been met with mixed reviews, most of them negative.  I agree with those critics, but I hope most will agree with me that with this 2007 edition, the WWE mostly got it right.1) United States ChampionshipMatt Hardy vs. M.V.P. (champion)---Both competitors have improved vastly within the past year, and show why they deserve the PPV spotlight and career pushes.  This opener is kept to a nice, and is filled with creative false finishes towards the end.  The finish is a tad weak, but this is a good way to kick off the show."7.0 out of 10"2) Open Invitational - Cruiserweight ChampionshipJimmy Wang Yang vs. Jamie Noble vs. Funakivs. Shannon Moore vs. Chavo Guerrero (champion)---I don't recall this being advertised for the PPV; SMACKDOWN sure knows how to deliver good PPV bonuses.  These five guys compete in an exciting one-fall match that finally allows this division to shine.  I hope the WWE allows this weight class to get some more much-needed airtime.  I think this clocked in at about 10 minutes, and the finish is a shocking surprise...No, I'm not giving it away (you probably know anyway)."7.0 out of 10"3) Singapore-Cane-On-A-PoleThe Sandman vs. Carlito---RAW's first match of the evening is more intriguing than it is exciting.  Carlito is capable of good matches, and Sandman really gives his best effort.  However, the showdown felt like a joke that has an amusing setup but without a punchline.  The Singapore Cane psychology is decent, but most viewers will be let down by this one."5.0 out of 10"4) Women's ChampionshipMelina vs. Candice Michelle (champion)--Boy, this one surprised the hell out of me!  These ladies avoid those stupid catfight antics, and showcase some nice takedowns and mat wrestling.  This isn't a great match, but it reminds us how the ladies can compete if given the chance.  The GoDaddy Girl and MNM Diva just reignited my interest in the Women's division."6.5 out of 10"5) Intercontinental ChampionshipJeff Hardy vs. Umaga (champion)---Another pleasant surprise, as things played out decently.  Umaga continues to be a dominant competitor without being invincible.  Jeff Hardy is resilient, and actually made me believe he could beat a superstar like Umaga.  Like the Women's Title Match, nothing to brag about, but much better than I thought it would be.  The San Jose crowd ate this one up; I'm gonna go with "not bad"."6.5 out of 10"6) ECW World TitleJohn Morrison (champion) vs. CM Punk---CM Punk and the man formerly known as "Johnny Nitro" continue to impress me.  Punk has been over with the fans for months, and Morrison has always been an entertaining superstar.  Like their VENGEANCE contest, these two convince skeptics like me to give ECW some more time to grow.  Their first encounter started a little slow and ended strong; this BASH rematch keeps a consistent solid pace...and then ends with a weak finish.  Seriously, I don't think I've seen a more ridiculous cause for a clean pinfall in my life.  Watch it, enjoy it, but be ready for an upsetting upset."7.0 out of 10"7) Texas Bullrope MatchRandy Orton vs. Dusty Rhodes---Ah, the disrespectful Legend Killer against the man who pioneered the Texas Bullrope Match.  Sorry folks, but JBL/Guerrero this ain't.  After some entertaining psychology and amusing spots during the opening minutes, this match just ends out of nowhere.  Even though Rhodes can't compete nearly at the level he used to, he still knows how to play a crowd.  I also believe Orton can sell punishment better than most.  Admirable effort, but not worth my PPV dollars."5.0 out of 10"8) World Heavyweight ChampionshipKane vs. Batista vs. The Great Khali (champion)---This SMACKDOWN main event has to have the most chaotic damage-control booking ever in the show's history.  I'll give you some history:* Kane had a title shot against Edge, but the Rated-R Superstar had to vacate his title due to injury.* Batista has failed to win this title back 5 times, all fair and square.  I have no idea why he's still in the title hunt.* The Great Khali was booked to have a grudge match against Batista, but won the vacant belt 2 days prior.  He later interfered in the Batista/Kane #1 Contender Match, which resulted in this 3-way affair.So what happens when these three giants compete for the gold?  Thankfully, SMACKDOWN's main event isn't a complete mess, but it's still not very good.  Khali is damn-near invincible (or just a no-seller), and Batista & Kane just don't mesh very well together.  The action is never unwatchable or slow, but ultimately unsatisfying."5.0 out of 10"9) WWE ChampionshipBobby Lashley vs. John Cena (champion)---Finally, we get to witness what may be RAW's biggest PPV main event of the year so far.  A lot of speculation went into this, as Lashley never lost his ECW World Title, and Cena has been in the WWE Title picture for over 2 years.  I was eagerly awaiting this clash of the titans, but I don't think the main event is as good as it could've been.  Lashley does most of the work, while Cena doesn't do anything you haven't seen him do before.  Seriously, other than some wicked shoot-takedowns from Lashley, there is no originality in this match whatsoever.  It's almost as if the first half of a classic battle was skipped, and we only got to see the breathtaking 10-minute conclusion.  Where's the buildup?  What's the rush?  Why only 13 minutes of bell-to-bell action?  I gave some other matches a 6.5, which was a compliment because they were much better than expected.  But this main event had weeks to hype, and while it's not bad, it's not the classic we knew these two were capable of."6.5 out of 10"OVERALLWhat this WWE GREAT AMERICAN BASH lacks is a classic showcase.  The inferior predecessors at least had a must-see match, like JBL/Guerrero or Booker/Mysterio.  The 2007 BASH is the WWE's best because it keeps a consistent pace and is never boring.  There's little talking, only one attempt at WWE comedy (which is actually funny for a change), and you can tell WWE put a strong effort into this PPV.  My personal review for this PPV is 3.5 stars, but I'm going to give it 4 stars because I'm sure most fans will enjoy some of the marquee matches more than I did.  At the very least, give GREAT AMERICAN BASH 2007 a rental.
summary: The Best of the WWE Bashes
Title: N/A

reviewText: Since the WWE brought back the Bash in 2004, they wasn't all that good, but I believe this was the best Bash the WWE has put on since bringing the Great American Bash back to ppv.1. United States ChampionshipMatt Hardy vs. MVPThis was one of the best openers of the year. These 2 really work well with each other and they put on a good showing. Lost of back and fourth action, a lot of close near pin falls, and some good wrestling to add to it. Great back and fourth match up. The crowd was very into this one. 4/52. Cruiserweight Open for the Cruiserweight ChampionshipChavo Guererro vs. Funaki vs. Shannon Moore vs. Jimmy Wang Yang vs. Jamie NobleThis wasn't a bad match whatsoever. Some good high flying offense and some good wrestling. I wasn't too fond of the conclusion but it worked in pretty well. 3/53. Singapore Cane on a Pole MatchSandman vs. CarlitoBefore I start, the cane does not even get used once in this entire match. Kind of boring but I really liked the ending, it was pretty good to me. 2.5/54. Women's ChampionshipMelina vs. Candice MichelleI give credit to these two divas, they really put on a good match. Its a shame that Candice got injured when she did, she is really trying to become the next Trish so a speak in wrestling ability for the divas now a days. This was a pretty darn good women's match up. 3.5/55. Intercontinental ChampionshipUmaga vs. Jeff HardyThis was another good match up as well. Umaga had his powerhouse and big impact moves going for him and Hardy had his classic Hardy high flying offense working for him too. Hardy did everything he could to beat Umaga but it didn't work for him this night. It was amazing to see Hardy picking up Umaga & trying to slam him. The crowd was really into this match as well. Very good match. 4/56. Ecw World ChampionshipCM Punk vs. John MorrisonThese 2 always put on a good show no matter what the situation is and this match was no exception. Pretty good match but it ended so suddenly. 4/57. Texas Bull Rope MatchRandy Orton vs. Dusty RhodesNow the match wasn't bad but it just didn't gave anything special besides a hard head shot with the cowbell at the end. Orton kills another legend. 3/58. World Heavyweight ChampionshipBatista vs. the Great Khali vs. KaneThis was pretty above average triple threat with these 3 big men. Khali really didn't do anything worth seeing but it got better when Kane and Batista took out Khali with the announce table. Good match to see after it was thrown together at the last minute on smackdown 2 days earlier. 3.5/59. WWE ChampionshipBobby Lashley vs. John CenaThis match really surprised me, a lot. Cena actually tryed to wrestle in this match but Lashley really did took Cena to school and back. Lashley proved he could be the champion one day and I believed he earned his in this match. Lashley really dominated Cena during this match. 4/5Like I said earlier, this was the best Great American Bash the WWE has put on since buying WCW in 2001. I recommend on getting your hands on this one.
summary: Best Great American Bash the WWE has put on

reviewText: 1) MVP VS MATT HARDY (UNITED STATES CHAMPIONSHIP MATCH)THIS MATCH IS SURPRISINGLY PRETTY GOOD! IT HAS A LOT OF NONSTOP ACTION THROUGHOUT THE MATCH. MVP FINISHES THE MATCH WITH A PLAYMAKER WINNER: MVP 7/102) CHAVO GUERRERO VS. JIMMY WANG YANG VS. FUNAKI VS JAMIE NOBLE VS SHANNON MOORE (CRUISERWEIGHT CHAMPIONSHIP OPEN)THIS MATCH IS AMAZING JUST BECAUSE OF THE ENDING..IT HAD THE MOST SURPRISING ENDING EVER! WINNER: OUT OF ALL PEOPLE HORNSWOGGLE!! 1000/103) CARLITO VS. SANDMAN (SINGAPORE CANE ON A POLE MATCH)THIS MATCH IS REALLY BORING AND THEY FIGHT BACK AND FORTH TRYING TO GET THE CAN DOWN AND THEN SANDMAN FINALLY GETS IT AND DOESNT EVEN GET A HIT ON CARLITO WITH IT! WINNER: CARLITO 5/104) CANDICE MICHELLE VS MELINA (WOMENS CHAMPIONSHIP MATCH)CANDICE MICHELLE IS THE BEST WOMENS CHAMP YET BESIDES TRISH..SHE HAS A LOT OF TALENT AND SHE SHOWS IT IN THIS MATCH WINNER: CANIDCE 7/105) UMAGA VS JEFF HARDY (INTERCONTINENTAL CHAMPIONSHIP MATCH)THIS MATCH WAS AWESOME CONSIDERING UMAGA HAS NO TALENT AT ALL! JEFF HARDY PUTS ON A HELL OF A SHOW IN THIS MATCH. AND HE COMES SO CLOSE TO WALKING AWAY WITH THE GOLD WINNER: UMAGA 8/106) JOHN MORRISON VS CM PUNK (ECW WORLD CHAMIONSHIP MATCH)THIS MATCH WAS OK..ITS BETTER THAN THE VENGEANCE MATCH FOR SURE BUT STILL NOT GREAT..HOPEFULLY THERE SUMMERSLAM MATCH WILL BE BETTER WINNER: JOHN MORRISON 7/107) RANDY ORTON VS DUSTY RHODES (TEXAS BULL ROPE MATCH)THEY CHANGED THE WHOLE PURPOSE OF A BULL ROPE MATCH..YOU HAVE TO PIN IN STEAD OF TOUCH ALL FOUR RING POSTS..I THOUGHT THAT THIS MATCH WAS HORRIBLE..BUT RANDY ORTON WINS AND THAT WAS THE ONLY GOOD THING WINNER: RANDY ORTON 6/108) THE GREAT KHALI VS BATISTA VS KANE (TRIPLE THREAT MATCH FOR THE WORLD HEAVYWEIGHT CHAMPIONSHIP)THIS WAS ACTUALLY PRETTY GOOD..KHALI MAKES A HORRIBLE CHAMPION THOUGH..THERE IS SOME COOL PARTS LIEK WHEN KANE AND BATISTA DO A SPINEBUSTER/CHOKSLAM TO KHALI THROUGHT THE ANNOUNCER TABLE WINNER: THE GREAT KHALI 8/109) BOBBY LASHLEY VS JOHN CENA (WWE CHAMPIONSHIP MATCH)THIS MATCH WAS THE BIGGEST DISSAPOINTMENT EVER!!! THIS MATCH HAD SO MUCH BUILD UP AND THEN IT WAS A COMPLETE FAILURE! I WAS WAITING TO SEE THIS MATCH SO BAD AND THEN IT WASNT ANYTHING SPECIAL! WINNER: JOHN CENA 7/10OVERALL ITS WORTH RENTING BUT NOT BUYING
summary: Best Great American Bash So Far!!!
